CONTRACT_ID: For a contract entitled:                    Improve the flow of geospatial information used to support diverse drought management activities in Canada.
description: This ACAN is to inform the supplier community that a contract will be awarded for geospatial information provision. Suppliers can submit a statement of capabilities to express their interest in the contract. If no supplier submits a capability statement, the contract will be awarded to the pre-selected supplier.
full_summary:
## Government Tender Announcement

### Tender Title
Improve the flow of geospatial information used to support diverse drought management activities in Canada.

### Tender Reference
PW-22-01009231

### Tender Description
The Natural Resources Canada (NRCan) intends to award a contract for the improvement of geospatial information used to support drought management activities in Canada. The estimated duration of the contract is 11 months, with the contract start date scheduled for November 1, 2022, and the contract end date scheduled for September 30, 2023.

The successful contractor will be responsible for delivering the project within the specified timeframe, which includes the period of November 1, 2022, to September 30, 2023.

### Contract Information

*   Contract Value: 1
*   Contract Type: Service
*   Award Method: Competitive - Limited Tendering

### Trades Agreements
This tender is subject to various trade agreements, including:

*   Canadian Free Trade Agreement (CFTA)
*   World Trade Organization Agreement on Government Procurement (WTO GPA)
*   Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-European Union Comprehensive Economic and Trade Agreement (CETA)
*   Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA)
*   Comprehensive and Progressive Agreement for Trans-Pacific Partnership (CPTPP)
*   Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA)
*   Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement
*   Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA)

### Contact Information

Catherine Boilard
Natural Resources Canada
1055, rue du PEPS, Québec, QC, G1V 4C7
Phone: 418-254-4482
Email: [catherine.boilard@rncan-nrcan.gc.ca](mailto:catherine.boilard@rncan-nrcan.gc.ca)
